main event: An unidentified aerial object was sighted in Sault St. Marie, Michigan on April 17, 1952, described as a pink, circular object that hovered in the sky.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for approximately 60 seconds., The object was thought to possibly be a weather balloon due to its color and behavior., A similar light was observed about 4.5 miles east of Sault Ste. Marie for eight minutes, described as bluish-green and 75 to 100 feet in length., Four potential explanations for the sighting were suggested, including reflections and aircraft., The weather conditions at the time of the sighting were noted to be clear with a temperature of 50 degrees.
sighted object: pink circular object and bluish-green light
witness description: Michigan State Highway Patrol received the report, but no other witnesses were confirmed.
